column1: Proud to help this Oregon company get federal clearance to become a major manufacturer of PPE to combat #COVID19 — first with face shields and now with N95 masks. This is the true spirit of the #OregonWay https://t.co/XVPQxXJPbq

Applications here in Oregon for this #COVID19 assistance filled in just three hours. This crisis is far from over. American families are in desperate need of help while Senate Republicans are looking the other way. https://t.co/2XF13x8smT

Great to celebrate with @SenJeffMerkley D6’s official opening of its N95 mask production space today in east Multnomah County. These masks made here in Oregon will help protect hundreds of thousands of people nationwide from #COVID19. #oregonway https://t.co/Fq4WKlzwAW

UPDATE: Republicans just blocked my bill to renew the additional $600/week income for unemployed workers. Republicans telling vulnerable families they're on their own is the economic equivalent of going for #COVID19 herd immunity. https://t.co/EridEG1crr

Heard yesterday in Bend from @RedCrossCasc about the need for donations of convalescent plasma from recovered #COVID19 patients. Info here about how to donate: https://t.co/oTivwPfGQQ https://t.co/CSFCrpwDdl

Thanks to @OSUCascades for hosting my on-line town hall today from Bend w/ @TownHallProject for Deschutes Crook & Jefferson counties. Great conversation about vote-by-mail the Supreme Court wildfires healthcare education the need for a coronavirus relief package & more. https://t.co/UqRkqAC1vf

Mitch McConnell can’t ignore public health scientific facts or common sense. The mounting toll of Republican senators testing positive for COVID-19 demands he halt this mad rush to install Donald Trump’s nominee on the Supreme Court with a lifetime appointment.

The #OregonWay was on full display today in Portland at @multco with this wonderful donation of 10000 children’s masks from D6 Inc. a local manufacturing company. Big thanks to #d6inc @dkafoury and @SMeieran for teaming up to keep kids safe during #COVID19. https://t.co/lBIOSAhqRp

From day one Donald Trump downplayed the severity of this crisis. Black Americans are disproportionately paying the price for his incompetence and inaction. I’ve been calling on Trump officials to track and report data on how #COVID19 is impacting Black nursing home residents. https://t.co/uXA98lRHqt

Heard today in Portland from @PPSConnect parents & teachers about the urgent need for the Senate to take up an A B Cs package that helps kids during #COVID19 - Aid to K-12 schools Better Broadband for students & Childcare support for working parents. https://t.co/K0eE4AYPNN

While Mike Pence spins a fictional tale of Trump's response to COVID-19 he's allowed nursing homes across the nation to run out of PPE during a pandemic that's proven most deadly to older generations. @SenBobCasey and I are sounding the alarm. https://t.co/bsFWknDWad

Let's be clear – the Trump administration doesn't have a plan to fight COVID-19 because it’s too busy sabotaging any effort to combat the virus. As a result it’s CHOOSING more infections more deaths and more economic pain. https://t.co/VffKfpQs2g

Good meeting today in Portland with Jeff Anderson of @UFCW & Bob Tackett of @steelworkers. Their @OregonAFLCIO members are #EssentialWorkers on the front line today and every day during #COVID19. These workers deserve our thanks and real Senate action to protect them. https://t.co/DHPv0fC0iZ

Impressed by the @uoregon students I met with yesterday in Eugene who are working as contract tracers to help combat #COVID19 in Lane County. This “Corona Corps” work supporting @LaneCoPH is a great #OregonWay example of the community coming together. https://t.co/rgQ7lkOqLn

From the start of the #COVID19 crisis our country has been short on the necessary PPE to protect our nation's health care workers. If you have experienced this PPE shortage firsthand I'd like to hear from you. Share your story: https://t.co/hcVBvsdZkM

Thanks to @latnet_PDX for a great Zoom conversation today about ways we can strategize here in Portland and everywhere to reduce the racial health disparities in Oregon and nationwide from #COVID19 https://t.co/2juJWGBcca

House Democrats passed their #COVID19 relief bill three months ago. The White House and Senate Republicans sat on their hands for months then skipped town to avoid getting Americans the help they desperately need. Every day Republicans fail to act families are paying the price.

If Donald Trump and Senate Republicans want to show they are serious about addressing this crisis they’ll include my proposal in the #COVID19 relief package currently being negotiated. https://t.co/ksQQYvsJyf

Taxpayers have invested billions to develop a safe and effective #COVID19 vaccine. I’m introducing legislation to lock in the price the federal government will pay for the vaccine to ensure taxpayers and consumers won’t be on the hook for price-gouging in the future.

Now more than ever Americans with disabilities need access to safe quality in-home health care so they can stay safe and healthy. I'm fighting hard for robust #HCBS funding in the next #COVID19 relief bill to protect our nation's most vulnerable from this deadly disease.

Mitch McConnell's Blueprint for Unemployment Cruelty:  1. Embrace a lapse in unemployment benefits 2. Convince workers they're doing them a favor by cutting their benefits 3. Argue that workers who are unemployed due to #COVID19 don't want to work

Donald Trump says he's planning to use his authoritarian tactics in cities nationwide. Instead of attacking peaceful protestors Trump should focus on attacking the coronavirus. https://t.co/y2HCz55sb7
Imagine if the Trump administration fought as hard against the coronavirus as it does against moms and veterans peacefully protesting. https://t.co/qpxRLKvaX5

The economic fallout from #COVID19 is painfully apparent in Eugene where @foodforlc is working hard to distribute food to hungry Oregonians. Clear evidence today & every day of the need to fight for #SNAP and extend supercharged unemployment benefits. https://t.co/qRstxz28lu

Heard firsthand today at @OregonFoodBank how important extending the supercharged unemployment benefit beyond the end of the month is to Lloyd Karlee and 1000s of unemployed Oregonians trying to make ends meet during #COVID19. This is top-priority business. https://t.co/71gVoSewtc

Thanks @lbcc for hosting today’s virtual townhall for Linn Benton & Lane counties while I’m in the Willamette Valley. And thanks to @townhallproject for throwing open the “digital doors” so Oregonians could ask me about job/business recovery during #COVID19 #VoteByMail & more. https://t.co/t0kMqhlBhk

Grateful to witness another fantastic #OregonWay example at work in Tigard yesterday where Pacific Coast Fruit delivered its millionth food box during #COVID19 to help vulnerable residents in communities throughout Oregon and the West. https://t.co/dXIL28G1LT

Huge thanks to @MultCoHealth for offering #COVID19 testing here in Gresham and for educating me this morning about how @MultCo is working hard to reduce racial disparities in all forms of health care. That’s a top priority for me as well on the Senate Finance Committee. https://t.co/XUh4QyoBt7

These @OregonGuard soldiers training to fight wildfires in our state are heroes and must go into this firefighting battle with the PPE they need during #COVID19. I’ll keep fighting to get them those resources so they can stay safe on the fire lines. https://t.co/OXwnlnHp6Q

.@TownHallProject is exactly right about the importance of virtual townhalls during #COVID19. I’m holding my 7th regional virtual townhall on July 14 for Oregonians in Lane Linn & Benton counties. Details here about how to participate: https://t.co/LtXgNNWpEG https://t.co/KUP3YPfHHI

Donald Trump spent his Fourth of July weekend standing up for Confederate statues. Meanwhile Democrats are busy standing up for the 330 million Americans under threat from #COVID19 and the 30 million workers on unemployment because of Trump’s failure to handle this crisis.

.@SenBobCasey @SenGaryPeters and I just released a report detailing the Trump administration’s failure to protect seniors in nursing homes from #COVID19. Donald Trump must be held accountable for failing to act as thousands of seniors died in this crisis. https://t.co/DaI41YLNgX

The numbers don't lie: communities in Oregon and nationwide have been hit with an economic wrecking ball by #COVID19. Last night I joined Senate Democrats to call for the passage of our bill to get communities the help they need. Senate Republicans objected. https://t.co/jfdCzewv0n

Honored to work with @KOBITV & all the great community partners in southern Oregon to make the importance of mental health = the importance of physical health. Here’s why that equation is crucial & especially now during #COVID19: https://t.co/CYQ7RdN08W

There is growing support for investing in job training programs proven to create good-paying jobs in rural communities. I have a bill to do just that. This is a must-do to help rural communities nationwide hit hard by #COVID19 and the upcoming fire season. https://t.co/aF3lxAs6iQ

#COVID19 + wildfires = a prescription for major problems. I won’t stop pressing federal officials for their plan to protect firefighters and rural communities in Oregon & nationwide during this pandemic. https://t.co/zaPL6STmax

America's health care system isn't colorblind. #COVID19 is hitting Black Americans hardest. It's time for Congress to address the racism and disparities that persist in our nation's health care system and create a system that better cares for every American. https://t.co/GUcpcddQFn

Between #COVID19 and wildfire season rural communities nationwide are being hit with an economic wrecking ball. My proposal to invest in job training programs proven to create good-paying jobs would be an economic lifeline for these communities. https://t.co/SohT8OReJ0

Donald Trump has made a lot of big promises to America’s seniors but hasn’t followed through on a single one. From inaction while thousands were dying in nursing homes from #COVID19 to standing idle while Big Pharma keeps price gouging Donald Trump has failed America’s seniors. https://t.co/4ohebuCCdn

I’m demanding answers from Trump officials about how they plan to protect our courageous firefighters from #COVID19 during the wildfire season. At today’s Senate Energy and Natural Resources hearing their message was loud and clear: the administration needs to be doing more. https://t.co/h1XrN7axeS

The Trump administration has failed Americans — especially people of color — when it comes to its handling of the #COVID19 crisis. From lagging behind on a national testing strategy to peddling conspiracy theories about hydroxychloroquine Trump has failed this country.

Juvenile detention facilities are facing dangerously high rates of #COVID19. @SenKamalaHarris and I are leading our Senate colleagues in demanding answers from Trump officials about the steps they’re taking to keep incarcerated youth safe during this crisis. https://t.co/xeNuYoa7DC

Great (socially distant) visit yesterday to see firsthand how D6 has re-tooled its shop to manufacture PPE for frontline workers using recycled materials. This Oregon company created jobs saved lives and is a true example of the #OregonWay. https://t.co/WkkAyVQThR

All over Oregon school staff have volunteered during #COVID19 to help get food to kids. Thanks to all of these #OregonWay superstars. I was happy to help @ppsconnect volunteers today at Woodmere School in Portland perform this vital service. https://t.co/nznwjHZJiK
Supporting neighborhood businesses like the @PortlandMercado is especially important during #COVID19. And in this case — with the tacos I got today that support is also tasty. https://t.co/YmqEcQ1Yrt

For months Americans have witnessed nursing homes nationwide get hit with a wrecking ball by #COVID19. This week I got confirmation from federal watchdogs that for years nursing homes have been unprepared to deal with a health care crisis like this. https://t.co/nM4qMxdxeJ

Our nation’s nursing homes have been hit with a wrecking ball by #covid19. Unprecedented challenges should’ve been met with decisive action. To protect America's seniors the federal government must supercharge testing and safety measures in nursing homes. https://t.co/y3RhwUrNKK

Read more from @thebulletin ed board about my 21st Century Conservation Corps for Our Health & Jobs Act which community leaders agree will help tourism reduce wildfire risks and more in Oregon during #COVID19: https://t.co/BF81OlDsQq

A few days ago Mitch McConnell said point blank that he hasn’t “felt the urgency of acting immediately” on the next #COVID19 relief bill. If 36 million Americans laid off and nearly 85000 dead isn’t urgent I don’t know what is. https://t.co/exKcxGLux9
Proud to work with @SenDuckworth on her common-sense & bipartisan bill to help new parents get #COVID19 stimulus checks ASAP: https://t.co/Idsf9RSLEB

.@HouseDemocrats' latest #COVID19 relief package includes a critical provision to give every American the option to #VoteByMail in November. If Republicans refuse to support it that tells you all you need to know about who is really fighting to defend our democracy.

Crises like #COVID19 highlight the urgent need for Oregon to have a strategic food reserve for emergencies. Here’s more on how I think that prep can be achieved for pandemics earthquakes tsunamis or any disaster. https://t.co/urrOh1cc5I

Protecting health and creating jobs during #COVID19 is urgent business in rural communities in Oregon and nationwide. Looking forward to getting this legislation passed on a bipartisan basis to help firefighters recreation workers and more: https://t.co/4ruYN3KwKy

Small businesses like @1188BrewingCo in John Day are the backbone of the rural Oregon economy. Here in the @MyEagleNews is my proposal to help the smallest businesses throughout Oregon & nationwide during #COVID19: https://t.co/OryJIOS86i

Even corporate America agrees that #COVID19 relief funds should have gone to workers and businesses in need. That's why I have a bill to give cash directly to small businesses to help them stay afloat. https://t.co/9jmkVvftmm
The head of the national coronavirus task force doesn't know how masks work. https://t.co/o2y36ZpCpw

Glad that the self-employed gig workers and others who I worked to include in the supercharged unemployment insurance needed to weather #COVID19 can now get benefits in Oregon and that their claims will be paid retroactively. https://t.co/XPXkUZj46S

Like so many businesses during #COVID19 newspapers in Oregon and nationwide are struggling – all at a time when reliable news is key.  As the son of a journalist I know how vitally important newspapers are to their communities. https://t.co/5aR8UgMiIy

The same Republicans who voted in favor of blowing a $2 trillion hole in the deficit in 2017 are now crying foul as Democrats fight to extend a lifeline for the millions of Americans that have lost their jobs because of #COVID19.

#COVID19 has shown us that America's health care system is dangerously unprepared for a public health crisis. Now more than ever we need a system that will provide quality affordable care for every single American. The solution is strengthening Medicaid. https://t.co/WzoO2lhT3E
While I’m fighting every day to get our state everything that’s needed to weather #COVID19 I am incredibly inspired by all of these #OregonWay stories. Thanks to all.
Demonstrating the #OregonWay with #GoBeavs flair @OregonState students are providing @cityofcorvallis residents with coronavirus test kits: https://t.co/Y209bnq8mw
Oregonians have met the huge health & economic challenges of #COVID19 with an #OregonWay ethic of pulling together to help neighbors and communities. Here are some of the many who deserve thanks.

We have a lot of heavy lifting to do when it comes to helping rural America weather the #COVID19 crisis. I'm fighting to get rural counties in Oregon the economic resources they need and to ensure rural health care providers don't fall between the cracks. https://t.co/Lsh84rQDFw

With thousands of seniors in nursing homes dying due to #COVID19 it's clear federal authorities are failing to keep seniors safe. I'm demanding higher safety standards and transparency from Trump officials when it comes to protecting seniors. https://t.co/WJUgZPOtZ8

NEW: @SenAmyKlobuchar @ChrisCoons and I are calling on House and Senate leaders to include additional funding for #VoteByMail in the next #COVID19 relief package. We won't stop fighting until every single American has the option to vote from the safety of their home in November. https://t.co/0FXCLlEp9K

These numbers won't stop rising any time soon. This is all the more reason for Congress to continue working on the next bipartisan #COVID19 relief package to give American workers the help they need to weather this economic storm. America's economic future depends on it. https://t.co/7r83Y9P9S4

In case you weren’t already convinced that every American should have the option to #VoteByMail in November what’s happening in Wisconsin is further evidence that we need to COVID-proof our elections. https://t.co/nIUgBQIgAw

I joined @DFADCoalition to discuss the urgent need to COVID-proof America's elections by implementing nationwide #VoteByMail. We cannot let Trump and McConnell get away with forcing Americans to choose between their health and their right to vote this November. #ProtectOurVote https://t.co/D2XihmGMxd

I'm joining @maziehirono in introducing the Coronavirus Immigrant Families Protection Act to ensure that the millions of immigrants putting their lives on the line are able to get the #COVID19 care testing and other supports they need to stay safe.
The health & economic challenges posed by #COVID19 are obviously front-and-center but it’s also good to remember the many inspiring #OregonWay stories during the coronavirus crisis.
Our economy will not recover until we stop the virus. That means we need a national blueprint to make accurate #COVID19 testing available to every single American.

#COVID19 poses a unique risk to seniors and those in nursing homes. It’s unacceptable that @CDCgov and @CMSgov won't disclose the number of cases in nursing homes after @SenBobCasey and I pressed for answers. We must do better to protect America’s seniors from this virus.

.@SenSchumer @PattyMurray and I are calling on the Trump administration to immediately send #COVID19 relief funds to the hardest hit frontline health care providers so they are better equipped to fight the virus and keep patients safe. This is not the time for political games. https://t.co/RIFdJ2U2P3

.@SenSchumer and I led Senate Democrats in pressing Trump's Labor Department to clarify guidelines and requirements so workers who have lost their jobs because of #COVID19 get the help they need as soon as possible. This can’t wait. https://t.co/N0NhW0BDg2
These are just a few of the many #OregonWay stories that have arisen statewide to fight #COVID19. If you want to spotlight similar stories please add them in the “replies.”
City workers in Hermiston are going the extra mile by calling every business in town to give them key information that can help them survive the #COVID19 economic fallout https://t.co/RZ0bd2m2Ay

The #COVID19 public health crisis has created huge challenges but let’s also remember everybody who’s responded with an #OregonWay blend of heroism hard work & innovation to help communities statewide.
Since the start of the pandemic Mitch McConnell has blocked the inclusion of my bill to expand #VoteByMail through the November election in any #COVID19 relief package.

Donald Trump is attacking his own administration's top watchdog for explaining the stark reality facing America's hospitals. Our health care workers don't have the resources they need to fight the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/j0g2aqZJ3D
I am fighting like hell to get #VoteByMail included in the next #COVID19 relief package. This cannot happen in November. https://t.co/EQSch5pHP0
If you know other #OregonWay stories that should be highlighted during the #COVID19 public health crisis please share in the “replies.”
Thanks to @OregonState for producing critical #COVID19 test materials that Oregon hospitals need: https://t.co/jrsM73Xbnr

While the #COVID19 battle is round-the-clock business let’s also take a moment to thank Oregonians putting the #OregonWay into practice by working & volunteering to help their communities during this public health crisis.

If you’re a worker who has lost your job or a business struggling to stay afloat because of the #COVID19 crisis my staff and I are here to help. Check out my new resource page to get the help you need: https://t.co/MrWr8sG0eG

My provision in the #COVID19 relief bill supercharges unemployment to provide workers with an additional $600 a week. This will be a lifeline for the millions of workers who have been hit by this economic wrecking ball.

On day one of negotiations for the #COVID19 relief package I made it clear that my bottom line was helping workers replace lost wages. Modernizing our outdated unemployment system ensures that all workers — including self-employed and gig economy workers — get the help they need. https://t.co/3NwsspRCiu

The #OregonWay is on full display in @SpringfieldPS where cooks & others getting meals to students during the #COVID19 crisis got this well-deserved & socially distanced celebration. https://t.co/icYmdl3Epm

Workers who have lost their jobs can't afford to wait for help. @SenSanders @SenSchumer and I are asking the Labor Department to expedite distribution of supercharged unemployment we secured in the #COVID19 relief package to get Americans the help they urgently need. https://t.co/RxV4V8R6Ql

.@SenSherrodBrown @SenSchumer and I are demanding Steve Mnuchin fulfill his commitment to independent oversight and ensure that #COVID19 emergency relief and loans go to workers and struggling businesses. Not a slush fund to benefit Donald Trump’s friends and donors. https://t.co/vxPTFa4rso

An inspiring #OregonWay story in the @Oregonian of how @woodenshoetulp is using tulips to brighten lives in assisted living centers statewide during the #COVID19 public health crisis https://t.co/EuwnPIqpbu

NEW: Earlier this week I discovered a crucial error in Trump administration guidance for the #COVID19 relief bill that would block states like Oregon from getting additional Medicaid dollars for home-based care for seniors and patients with disabilities.

Good discussion yesterday with Oregon hospitals. Under the #COVID19 relief package hospitals in rural areas and on the front lines can get their Medicare payments up front so they’re able to continue serving patients even when they are short of funds.

While I’m here in DC continuing to work on getting #COVID19 assistance that all Oregonians need I’ll also continue highlighting these #OregonWay heroes. In the “replies” please feel free to share similar stories.
There are so many wonderful #OregonWay examples to spotlight of Oregonians throughout our state pulling together during the #COVID19 public health crisis.

Throughout negotiations of the #COVID19 response package my top priority was ensuring that Oregonians who have lost their jobs because of this crisis could still pay bills and put food on the table. The provision I secured to supercharge unemployment benefits will do just that. https://t.co/9f5hS5wpvm

Just finished a phone call with ER docs on the front lines fighting the #COVID19 public health crisis throughout Oregon. Let’s all support these amazing Oregon docs by doing our part to flatten the curve and staying home. This is the #OregonWay.

Donald Trump is giving Americans a false choice between fighting the coronavirus and saving the economy. His prescription for helping our economy will only make Americans sicker.  Our economy cannot recover unless we stop the virus.

New estimates today show that unemployed Oregonians will get an estimated $3.3 billion in much-needed help this year as part of the historic unemployment insurance expansion I worked to get into the #COVID19 package: https://t.co/c2OY35w7Au

Anyone who knows me knows I prefer a good old-fashioned town hall. But this weekend you’ll find me at my desk taking calls with Oregon businesses and state county and local leaders to answer questions and discuss what the #COVID19 package means for Oregon workers and businesses. https://t.co/BCGmSDeblr

My plan in the just-passed #COVID19 package to supercharge unemployment insurance so it makes sense in the 21st century for gig workers & everybody who’s lost their job is explained in this piece I wrote for @ThePortlandTribune https://t.co/DBQmaY9x3E
In the middle of the #COVID19 public health crisis there are also many poignant & powerful #OregonWay stories of neighbors helping neighbors.

While not a panacea for the health and economic impacts of #COVID19 this package will help American families workers and businesses weather this storm. I will continue fighting for the resources Oregonians and their loved ones need to stay safe and healthy.

While pushing corporate bailouts Senate Republicans are also trying to strip my provision to expand unemployment insurance from the #COVID19 package. They are playing partisan games with the livelihoods of workers who will lose their jobs. https://t.co/CwdppNXvFV

When unemployment insurance was created in the 1930s no one ever used the term gig economy worker. The bipartisan #COVID19 deal contains my provision to supercharge unemployment insurance to help ALL workers who have lost their jobs and are feeling an economic impact. https://t.co/jVEJfycVeq

In the middle of the #COVID19 public health crisis it’s important for all of us as Oregonians to take a moment to thank all those putting the #OregonWay into practice by working 24-7 to keep people safe.

A critical part of preparing for and responding to #COVID19 is ensuring that every American has coverage to see a health care provider. No one should have to choose between putting food on the table and seeking life-saving care. Thanks to the ACA they don't have to.

Ten years ago today the Affordable Care Act became law. Since then we've seen countless reminders about why it's so important that every American has access to quality affordable care. Few of these reminders has come as swiftly as the #COVID19 outbreak.

I just voted no on the partisan #COVID19  bill. Here's why: while nurses are being forced to make their own masks and gowns McConnell and Trump are busy creating a taxpayer-funded slush fund for their buddies. I will stay here as long it takes to get this done the right way.

Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump need to accept the fact that the cure for #COVID19 isn't a secretive taxpayer-funded bailout of multinational corporations. This deal will get done but it’s got to get done the right way.

Moving forward without a bipartisan deal that gives workers and small businesses the help they need in addition to critical health provisions would add insult to injury for the Americans who are bearing the brunt of #COVID19's economic consequences.
Donald Trump hid information about the severity of #COVID19 to save face and now Americans are paying the price. https://t.co/LH4lgkJL2i

In light of Donald Trump's failure to swiftly address the global health crisis Congress just passed emergency legislation to provide free #COVID19 testing for every American. This is a good step but I won't stop fighting to get Oregonians the resources they need to stay healthy.

I know how @MealsonWheelsPpl has long been a lifeline for older adults. During this #COVID19 outbreak its work is more important than ever. If you’re interested check out all it’s doing and find out how you can help: https://t.co/fcf6SwYtQ3

It's official: @SenAmyKlobuchar and I just introduced our bill to require #VoteByMail through November. Mitch McConnell should commit to including our proposal in the next #COVID19 package so states won't be forced to choose between holding elections and keeping people safe.

Once again Donald Trump is resorting to racism and finger-pointing to hide his failure to step up during a crisis. This is a blatant attempt to distract from the disastrous shortage of #COVID19 tests and the economic pain it's causing as Americans are quarantined. https://t.co/O2KNZLhAiy

I talked with @crookedmedia about the urgent need to secure our elections during the #COVID19 crisis by requiring #VoteByMail nationwide through November. America has a long history of moving quickly when our constitutional rights are on the line. This should be no exception. https://t.co/W46vkBCEBt

The law already allows disclosure of Americans' location data during emergencies if lives are threatened. It makes sense to consider using location data to notify people who may have been exposed to #COVID19 but only with strict protection for Americans' security and rights. https://t.co/NDujy1bfPq
No one is immune to the consequences of #COVID19. The best thing you can do to protect yourself your loved ones and your community is stay at home. https://t.co/aIvZDYzUJF
Delaying the tax deadline will help keep Americans safe and lessen the economic burden on workers impacted by #COVID19. This is a must-do. https://t.co/nKPQz3fnqH

As the son of a journalist I know reporters play a key role in providing information their communities need daily & especially in challenging times. Glad to see this initiative by Oregon newsrooms across our state during the #COVID19 public health crisis. https://t.co/ArFdhWScoQ

🚨The risks posed to elections by #COVID19 are becoming clearer by the day. @SenAmyKlobuchar and I will introduce new legislation to help states use #VoteByMail through November so voters don’t have to choose between exercising their constitutional rights and staying healthy. https://t.co/ZiOusweW8g
Based on my conversations here in Oregon with those on the front lines of this #COVID19 outbreak I know our community will come through this challenge together in the true spirit of the #OregonWay.

Oregonians waking up this Sunday to news of our state’s first confirmed #COVID19 death can feel angry about the federal response to this public health crisis. I’m right there with you and am working to get Oregon what it needs. https://t.co/iSxTeE6Kwy
I join with all Oregonians in mourning the death of a veteran to #COVID19 and know our entire state grieves this loss with this man’s family friends and loved ones. https://t.co/g2fn1OWqHp

I’m at home in Portland and was just briefed by health officials on the latest #COVID19 situation in eastern Oregon. Mitch McConnell must bring the House package to the Senate for a vote immediately to bring relief and peace of mind to communities across Oregon and the country. https://t.co/SStBzcCUUu
We need swift science-based action to mitigate the spread and consequences of #COVID19. These Oregon-based doctors have a plan. The Trump administration should listen. https://t.co/OhJlSFJBXJ

Briefed today at the @vaportland Hospital by officials working hard to keep veterans & their loved ones safe in Oregon & nationwide during #COVID19. They told me all Oregon hospitals having the ability to do on-site tests is key to reduce wait times for results. I agree. https://t.co/15npFxSnCX

Oregonians urgently need more testing equipment lab tests surgical masks respirators ventilators & more for #COVID19. Working w/ @SenJeffMerkley @repblumenauer  @RepPeterDeFazio & @RepBonamici to press @VP to help our state. https://t.co/iSxTeEolo6

Proud to stand (with proper #COVID19 social distancing) this morning in Portland with strong allies like @nextuporegon @ULPDX & @voteathome for my Resilient Elections During Quarantines & Natural Disasters Act. https://t.co/EONxJemhuc
In the interest of minimizing potential health risks to Oregonians from #COVID19 I am postponing my #2020townhalls in Baker Union and Gilliam counties this weekend. More here: https://t.co/oHvgNI1tov

Democrats’ “ideological wish list”:   ✔️Paid sick leave for workers ✔️Free #COVID19 testing ✔️Relief for people who lose work   Otherwise known as critical steps we should be taking to protect Americans and their loved ones. https://t.co/tAdZIT5ooQ

No voter should have to choose between exercising their right to vote and putting their health at risk. I just introduced legislation to protect voters and our elections against #COVID19 risks by mandating emergency #VoteByMail for all federal elections. https://t.co/9fWa9hWIZ6
The latest addition to Donald Trump's coronavirus response wish list is a corporate tax change that lobbyists have been demanding nonstop for two years. Let that sink in. https://t.co/dOLJdogPxn
